intro: Microseris aphantocarpha, commonly known as the narrowleaf biscuitroot, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as prairies and rocky soils. It has slender, hairy stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. Its yellow flowers bloom in the spring, and it produces small, hard seeds that are dispersed by wind.
